name: Portfolio
image_alt: GIF showing the usage of the portfolio
description: A fully featured personal portfolio website that offers a preview page of new additions and highlights, easy and dynamic adding of new blog posts and projects, a contact page and some additional features
background:
For a while, I've been meaning to create a personal portfolio, but due to school and work taking up quite a large chunk of my time, it kept getting pushed to the back burner. But as the semester's coming to an end, I finally felt it was about time to finish this up and actually put it to good use. The site isn't just a place to showcase my work—it's also meant to demonstrate my thought process and to serve as a public record of my progress, showing how far I've come and how far I can go.


While I originally created it for my personal use, I've open-sourced it and designed it in a way that lets anyone (with some minor tweaks) to take the base I've built and use it for themselves—no holds barred. If you're interested, check out the README on GitHub for instructions.


If you find any bugs or have suggestions for updates or changes, feel free to reach out via the contact form above!
features:
• A dynamic preview system that displays new additions to the portfolio as well as highlights manually set by the developer
  • An array of blog posts and projects that the developer can show off, including a dedicated page for each project/post with some extra information
  • A contact form that is both secure and easy to use
  • A resume embedded into the page
  • Keybinds for easy site traversal (1-6)
  • Live GIFs that display how a project can be used
  • Scripts to easily update the database based on JSON data
